title: Recent Research on Fasting and Calorie Restriction
editorial: This issue highlights new insights into how calorie restriction and intermittent fasting reshape adipose tissue, muscle stem cell biology, eye and bone health, dietary patterns, and cancer care. Together, these studies illustrate the systemic and tissue-specific coordination of metabolic rhythms.

studies.title: Caloric restriction reprograms adipose tissues in rhesus monkeys
studies.summary: In rhesus monkeys, long-term caloric restriction profoundly remodeled adipose tissue metabolism, improving mitochondrial function and reducing inflammatory signaling.
studies.commentary: These findings reinforce the translational relevance of primate models for understanding long-term metabolic adaptation to calorie restriction.

studies.title: The central clock drives metabolic rhythms in muscle stem cells
studies.summary: This study showed that the circadian clock orchestrates metabolic rhythms in muscle stem cells, regulating their activation, maintenance, and regenerative capacity.
studies.commentary: Muscle health depends not only on energy availability, but also on precise temporal coordination of metabolism.

studies.title: Intermittent fasting protects against retinal degeneration
studies.summary: In a mouse model of age-related macular degeneration, intermittent fasting reduced glial hyperactivation and preserved photoreceptor structure.
studies.commentary: Fasting rhythms may offer neuroprotective benefits for age-related eye diseases.

studies.title: Intermittent fasting improves diabetic osteoporosis via interorgan communication
studies.summary: Intermittent fasting slowed the progression of diabetic osteoporosis in mice by coordinating signaling between the gut, bone, and metabolic tissues.
studies.commentary: These results highlight fasting as a systemic intervention acting through interorgan crosstalk.

studies.title: South Asian dietary pattern supports calorie restriction in young adults
studies.summary: A randomized controlled trial in young adults with overweight showed that a South Asian food pattern was effective within a calorie-restricted diet for weight management.
studies.commentary: Culturally adapted diets can support calorie restriction without compromising adherence.

studies.title: Intermittent energy restriction during chemotherapy for breast cancer
studies.summary: In a phase-2 trial, intermittent energy restriction combined with resistance exercise was tested during chemotherapy for advanced breast cancer.
studies.commentary: This study explores how metabolic interventions may complement cancer treatment while preserving physical function.
